channel.title: Homes on Mark Jellicoe
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Mark Jellicoe

item.title: Academic

item.description: Biography I am a part-time Ph.D candidate at the University of Liverpool (UoL). My doctoral research focuses on factors associated with gainful learning in undergraduate students. This research draws on social cognitive and goal setting theories as its focus. In particular, I am interested in how goals can be used to embed the feedback received by students to inform their future learning. I hold a part time role in the School of Psychology at UoL.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am a demonstrator for the following courses at the University of Liverpool in 2017-18: PSYC234/5: Research Methods and Statistics (Second Year Undergraduates) I acted as a demonstrator on the following courses, between 2015-17: PSYC122/3: Transferable Skills (First Year Undergraduates) PSYC124/5: Research Methods and Statistics (First Year Undergraduates) I lectured on the following modules in 2017-18: PSYC127: Pscyhology in the Real World PSYC215: Psychology at Work^ ^ for which I was awarded the Sir Alistair Pilkington Faculty Teaching and Learning Award in 2017-18.
